page.title: 09 Religion in Weaverthorpe
page.content: Most people in the locality are {Church of England}or{Methodists,}at least nominally. In the village are the{Methodist {Chapel}and the{Parish Church}(about 100 yards north of the D block). The old galleried chapel was pulled down and the Sunday-school room was extended and offically opened in July 1985. There is a weekly service and Junior church on Wednesdays. It is part of the{Sherburn Circuit.} {The Church of St. Andrew's}dates from 1110.{Street}renovated it in 1872. People visit from all over England, and the former Dominions. There is a weekly service. The{Vicar lives at Helperthorpe. It is part of the{Buckrose Deanery.} Although both have small regular congregations, most of the village helps support them financially.
